conclusion: Determine the correct statement about the accelerations of Car A and Car B from t=0 to t=t1 using the velocity-time graph.
The velocity-time graph shows how velocity changes over time for both cars.
The slope of the graph at any point represents the acceleration of the car at that moment.
For Car A, the curve starts at a higher velocity v2 and decreases as time increases.
The slope of Car A’s curve is negative and decreasing, indicating that the magnitude of acceleration is decreasing over time.
The deceleration (negative acceleration) of Car A is lessening, but it is still decreasing in velocity.
For Car B, the curve starts at a lower velocity v1 and increases as time increases.
The slope of Car B’s curve is positive and increasing, indicating that the magnitude of acceleration is increasing over time.
Car B is accelerating, and its acceleration is increasing.
Car A's acceleration magnitude is decreasing (becoming less negative).
Car B's acceleration magnitude is increasing (becoming more positive).
The magnitude of the acceleration of Car A gradually decreases, while the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B gradually increases.
